statement:
**Theorem.** Let $\mathfrak{a}_1$, …, $\mathfrak{a}_n$ be invertible
fractional ideals of a Prüfer ring. Then also their sum and intersection
are invertible, and the inverse ideals of these are obtained by the
formulae resembling de Morgan’s laws:
$$(\mathfrak{a}_1+\cdots+\mathfrak{a}_n)^{-1} \;=\; 
\mathfrak{a}_1^{-1}\cap\cdots\cap\mathfrak{a}_n^{-1}$$
$$(\mathfrak{a}_1\cap\cdots\cap\mathfrak{a}_n)^{-1} \;=\;  
\mathfrak{a}_1^{-1}+\cdots+\mathfrak{a}_n^{-1}$$\
This is due to the fact, that the sum of any ideals is the smallest
ideal containing these ideals and the intersection of the ideals is the
largest ideal contained in each of these ideals. Cf. sum of ideals,
quotient of ideals.

[9]{} : “Some formulae for multiplying and inverting ideals”. $-$
*Annales universitatis turkuensis* **183**. Turun yliopisto (University
of Turku) 1982.
